fields.summary: Insufficient field length does not allow deploying apps
fields.description:
The field length of the FILTER field in the ROLE_PERMISSION table does not allow provisioning a new app to the App Library.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Copy the link to the Deployment Descriptor for any app that needs to be provisioned to Mindtap.
2. Navigate to the App Library page after logging in as a user with Super admin role.
3. Click on the Deploy App button.
4. Paste the link to the Deployment Descriptor (copied above) in the Config URL.
5. Choose an appropriate Provision mode and Category (if needed; both are not required).
6. Click Deploy.

Expected Result: App should get deployed successfully and a success message should appear on the top of the screen.

Actual Result: The App does not get deployed and displays the following error to the user and the following exception in the logs.
(This error is easiest to reproduce on Appdev environment.)

Error to the user: Error: An unknown error occurred: NucleusUserException

Exception in the Logs:
[2012-08-24 09:35:51,217] ERROR  transactions.JDOTransactionalInterceptor -- Nested transaction scope; marking tx as rollbackOnly
[2012-08-24 09:35:51,217] ERROR  transactions.JDOTransactionalInterceptor -- Rolling back transaction due to uncaught exception
Attempt to store value "id=1,7,11,13,14,18,24,44,65,66,12,25,29,186,187,21,221,233,240,241,266,81,287,286,290,334,293,292,305,304,299,298,311,310,317,316,323,322,329,328,335,338,339,342,343,350,353,355,361,356,364,372,373,377,384,436,437,442,452,479,480,486,485,487,488,493,542,543" in column "`FILTER`" that has maximum length of 250. Please correct your data!
org.datanucleus.exceptions.NucleusUserException: Attempt to store value "id=1,7,11,13,14,18,24,44,65,66,12,25,29,186,187,21,221,233,240,241,266,81,287,286,290,334,293,292,305,304,299,298,311,310,317,316,323,322,329,328,335,338,339,342,343,350,353,355,361,356,364,372,373,377,384,436,437,442,452,479,480,486,485,487,488,493,542,543" in column "`FILTER`" that has maximum length of 250. Please correct your data!

        at org.datanucleus.store.mapped.mapping.SingleFieldMapping.setString(SingleFieldMapping.java:197)

fields.summary: Admin: Issues with titles when adding Reading Activities via Activity Manager
fields.description:
Exists in all Big Five books.

Taking Ehrlich as the worst example.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Log in as a SuperAdmin, launch Ehrlich Master.
2. Open LPN, click on any Chapter, click + Add Activity, click Reading Activity.
3. Observe the list of Reading Activities displayed and ensure the 1st and the last 6 Chapters (front and back matter) do not have Chapter number - screen shot 1.



+Case 1: clicking on Chapter link+ (not "Add Entire Chapter" link!)
1. Click on the link "Chapter 1: Introduction to Medical Terminology".
2. Expand the drop-down list.

Expected result 1: the 1st and the last 6 Chapters DO NOT have Chapter numbers.
Actual result 1: front and back matters have Chapter numbers and thus all Chapters have incorrect numbers - screen shot 2.

Expected result 2: "Chapter 1: Introduction to Medical Terminology" has the number "Chapter 1".
Actual result 2: Chapter with the title "Introduction to Medical Terminology" has the number "Chapter 2" - screen shot 2.


3. Check "Full Chapter", click Continue.

Expected result: text box "Title" should be prefilled with the title "Chapter 1: Introduction to Medical Terminology".
Actual result: text box is prefilled with the title "Medical Terminology" - screen shot 3.

_NOTE: text box is always prefilled with the title "Medical Terminology" - does not matter if a user is adding Full Chapter or A-Heads (in any Chapter, in any front/back matter)._ 
_Concerns: should the title text box be prefilled when addind A-Heads (one or several)? If prefilled - which title should be displayed if a user adds several A-Heads?_
 
4. Click Save.

Actual result: Chapter 1 has been added with the title "Medical Terminology" 
Expected result: reading activity name should be the chapter name when the full chapter has been selected. For one a-head or b-head, the reading activity name will match the selection. for reading activities that had more than one section selected, then the first selected A-head or B-head will be the default reading activity name




+Case 2: clicking on "Add Entire Chapter" link.+
1. Click on "Add Entire Chapter" link next to e.g., Chapter 1 and observe the "Title" text box which is prefilled.

Actual result: the title has no words "Chapter 1". Is it by design? -> To easy distinguish in LPN: if a Chapter has the number - it means that the Chapter has been created when the book has been created; and if a RA does not have Chapter number - it has been manually added?)

versions.description: Formerly known as 1.5 (which is now December)

fields.summary: Print: Print Options & Print this section
fields.description:
*As a MindTap user of any role, when I click the icon / indicator that shows I can print, I should see a print preview window which includes my print options so that I'm able to choose the section I need.*

* When a user clicks (or taps?) on the icon, print preview appears in a new window.
* User will see print options along the top of the page (see wireframes):
** _Entire Reading Activity_ - the entire chapter or section (Reading Activity) they are currently in (For example: printing all of Chapter 3) -- NOTE THAT THIS WILL NOT WORK AS PART OF THIS STORY (NG-11920 addresses print entire chapater)
** _This Section_ - the section of the reading they currently have open (For example: printing section 3-b only) - DEFAULT, automatically selected
** _Cancel_ - cancels out of print and closes the preview screen
** _Print_ - starts printing job via normal browser print controls
** I should *not* be able to print the entire textbook at one time.
* Note that the style of the Print preview here uses the print stylesheet

*Ask*
Think about how to make this more accessible, perhaps a new story?

*Assumption*
Supressed content will be shown on printouts.

fields.summary: Print Controls: Print Option Indicator
fields.description:
*As a MindTap user of any role, I should see an indication that I can print (icon), so that I know I can print sections of my MindTap to read and take notes when I'm not online.* 

Acceptance Criteria:
* Print indication does not appear on the LPN.
* Print indication appears on all reading activities:
** Chapter contents page
** A heads/B heads
** Non-book content, start of chapter and appendices
** Includes text in sidebars, tables, etc. although it does not need to be styled the way it is in the reader
** Also in the Full Book app

Note:
* Entire contents of the MindTap is *NOT* printable at one time

fields.summary: Print: Copyright information on First and Last Page, Preview and Printout
fields.description:
As a MindTap user of any role, when viewing my MindTap print-preview, I should see customized coypright information for my MindTap that the material is copyrighted and not intended for reproduction so that I know I cannot reproduce the material. This copyright should also appear in the printout.

*Acceptance Criteria*
* The following text will appear at the start of each printout/print preview (adding to every page is addressed in NG-12212):

# Chapter/Section/Unit/Folder number and name
# User Name: <logged in user first and last name>  Legal to confirm if we are allowed to include this, do not include for now?
# Book Title: <title of the eBook >
# ISBN: <MindTap ISBN> *assuming SSO ISBN, Amanda confirming with legal*
#  <DATE OF PUBLICATION OF THE PRODUCT BEING DISPLAYED>
#  <Insert appropriate year, current Title copyright> Cengage Learning Inc. All rights reserved. No part of this work may by reproduced or used in any form or by any means - graphic, electronic, or mechanical, or in any other manner - without the written permission of the copyright holder.

* text can flow onto 2 lines
* Will present any MathML text

Questions *(follow up by Bernard/Russell)*
--Do we know the source of all of the publication metadata?
Book Title: <title of the eBook >, <edition cardinal> Ed.
Book Title: <title of the eBook >
--Would like to have real examples of at least book / non-book of the publication metadata:
--can the book title can be removed if it isn't related to a book, not all MindTaps are related (C360, "Selections from")

* The following text will appear at the end of each printout/print preview (adding to every page is addressed in NG-12212):

#  <Insert appropriate year, current Title copyright> Cengage Learning Inc. All rights reserved. No part of this work may by reproduced or used in any form or by any means - graphic, electronic, or mechanical, or in any other manner - without the written permission of the copyright holder

_Questions_
* can the book title can be removed if it isn't related to a book, not all MindTaps are related (C360, "Selections from") *(Bernard/Russell to confirm)*
* what is their definition of MT ISBN? SSO ISBN and not the Core Text? (Amanda to confirm)

fields.summary: Review MySQL configuration and environments (formerly part of: POC for move from MySQL to Mongo)
fields.description:
Formerly part of: "Appification: POC for move from MySQL to Mongo"
This story is platform wide and not specific to Appification)
See also: NG-8952 (Analyse Slow MySQL for Progress Data)  & NG-9564 (Define use of MongoDB vs MySQL)

Analysis of MySQL environment.  Results of analysis should include:  

- review the MySQL server configurations compared to enterprise standards
- Identify gaps and recommendations
- Define a plan for productionising the MySQL environment including scaling, QA environments, failure, monitoring, Backup & recovery
- Communicate the plan to team members including Ops and Delivery

Here is a general plan on implementing this story:

- Identify data volumes and database call volumes
- Define server configuration recommendations
- Identify any additional hardware, software or processes to support the non-functional requirements


See also original spike:  
https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/NG-8519+Spike+Determine+if+Progress+Data+should+be+stored+in+My+SQL+or+Mongo

fields.summary: 07.12 Appification:  Analysis of MySQL performance problems for progress data (formerly POC for move from MySQL to Mongo)

AA : when multiple Inline AA on single RA page and passing FU by giving any of AA nodeid then System must focus on AA nodeid provided in FU , Currently Syatem lands User to the top of the Reading Activity page

Test Data used on QAE as
AA1 top having node id as 627479
AA2 middle having node id as 627480
AA3 bottom having node id as 627481

fields.summary: Configure font styling for math for inline, block and large tables
fields.description:
Adjust font size and weight in rendered math formulas in the following locations so it appears similar to font size/weight of surrounding text Currently the font appears larger and bolder (as in implying emphasis) than the surrounding text
* Main-flow, inline 
* Main-flow, block
* Enlarged table view

Biggest concerns are font weight and size

review complex fraction type equations which tend to appear in a smaller font size (need example from uberdoc)

Example screen shots attached
See screenshot attached to http://jira.cengage.com/browse/MTQA-13391
Uberdoc locations for testing (there are more but this is a representative example)
Table: section 13-2a: table 4.1
complex fraction type: 12-1 (two examples)
inline vs. block: 12-2a, Example 18, 13-1d


Out of Scope:
* Addressing varying font size between inline and block MathML
* Adjusting Font Size/Weight in:
** TOC links
** Chapter Headings in Reader and Full Book
** Chapter name in the header above a Reading Activity
** LPN
** Glossary Terms and Definitions
** Flash Cards
** Chapter Title widget
** Skimmer


refer to http://www.mathjax.org/docs/2.0/options/SVG.html for the options available to the SVG renderer as well as their defaults

Investigate how to make the font name/size we pass in configurable in a settings file instead of hard-wired into the java

The production logs show that either users or the system are attempting to submit assignments more than once. We should investigate to determine under what scenarios an error like this would happen (for example, clicking the submit button more than once, or maybe auto-submit?)
This error has occurred about seven times during the past week.

Uncaught Exception from Resource Method: javax.jdo.JDODataStoreException: Insert of object "com.cengage.nextbook.ActivityOutcomeDetail@25fda326" using statement "INSERT INTO `ACTIVITY_OUTCOME_DETAIL` (`STATUS`,`LAST_MODIFIED_BY`,`ACTIVITY_ID`,`TAKE_END_TIME`,`SCORE`,`CREATED_DATE`,`CREATED_BY`,`TAKE_NUMBER`,`USER_ID`,`TAKE_ID`,`IS_AUTO_SUBMITTED`,`LAST_MODIFIED_DATE`,`TAKE_START_TIME`,`VERSION`) VALUES (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?)" failed : Duplicate entry '2c303b72-679d-4c01-9380-940c8cc03973' for key 'AOD_TAKEID_UNQIDX'

fields.summary: Support MathML in LPN
fields.description:
as a user, I need to see MathML content in the LPN rendered correctly so I can identify the reading 

Implementation notes:

*Acceptance Criteria*
* server and client side
* mathml content appears in the LPN title for reader and coursemode MT's
** (?) verify this is only for coursemode at chapter level, I think coursemode at the A-head level requires NG-10791

* supports refresh LPN title workflow
* Support unicode entities on auto creation of a reading activity in the LPN title
* Support cl:style elements in the LPN titles for reading activities on reading activity creation

Out of Scope:
- manually added LPN titles
- LPN descriptions
- ability to edit in LPN title/description is a separate effort

Uberdoc Samples:
* Chapter 9 Title
* Part III: The Last Part
* Part III Part Overview
* Chapter 12
* Chapter 13
* Chapter 14
* Part III: Part Recap

fields.summary: BLOCKED: Support MathML in Reading Activity Header
fields.description:
h3. as a user, I need to see MathML content in the activity manager rendered correctly so I can identify the reading when it is open

Uberdoc location: Chapter 12 heading.

Implementation notes:

* From 8.29 team conversation, this is client-side only, dependent on the effort in the related story for display in LPN: NG-11681. This is a soft dependency, as that effort could be played as part of this story, depending on relative priority.
* From 9.12 team conversation: we need to consider design implications of formulas pushing the size of the frame border that contains the Reading Activity Header


*Acceptance criteria*
* mathml should render in the activity header that appears above the reading activity
* refresh of an existing, automatically created MT with update LPN titles option enabled will update the activity header if the  title changed to include mathML
* Support unicode entities on auto creation of a reading activity in the LPN title
* Support cl:style elements in the LPN titles for reading activities on reading activity creation

Uberdoc Samples:

* Chapter 9 Title
* Part III Part Overview
* Chapter 12
* Chapter 13
* Chapter 14
* Part III: Part Recap

fields.summary: Reader Page> Add Text Box> Link a text> Added URL in "Insert/Edit Link" is not displayed in Firefox after editing the Inline Text Box however it is displayed in Chrome and IE.
fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 
1. Launch the URL: http://qad-ng.cengage.com/static/nb/login.html 
2. Login with valid Uid/Password: functionaladmin/A111111. 
3. Open any book.
4. Click on any chapter.
5. Add inline text box to Reading.
6. Add text and hyperlinked that text and save the text box.
7. Edit Inline Text Box and click on "Insert/Edit Link".

Actual Result: Added URL in "Insert/Edit Link" is not displayed in Firefox after editing the Inline Text Box however it is displayed in Chrome and IE.

Expected Result: Added URL should display in "Insert/Edit Link" in Firefox as it displayed in Chrome and IE.

Note: Please refer to the zip file <<Text_box_link_issue.zip>> for more detail.

fields.summary: RSS Feed App must save to Master upon saving Working Copy
fields.description:
As a Builder (SuperAdmin, Production, Vendor roles), I want to be able to save the changes I make to the RSS Feed App on the dock (in a Working Copy) to a Published Master, so that I have a way to make changes to this app in that case.

Acceptance Criteria:
* Any edit made to the RSS Feed App in a Working Copy should be saved to that Master when the Working Copy is merged to the Master
* Any changes to the URL or Title or Before/After text in the Working Copy should be merged to the RSS Feed App *and* Activities that use the given Feed

* Related to NG-11813, which will remove the ability to edit in the RSS Feed app based on it being in a Published Master

fields.summary: Refresh Score does not update attempt count if it actually closes an attempt
fields.description:
attempt is a counter that is set at the Activity Outcome level and indicates the number of attempts taken by the current user. It is a denormalized value (probably to avoid a count on the Activity Outcome Detail). It is a key value as it is used in the UI to determine if the user can start a new take.

The way it is coded now the counter will not be incremented if an attempt is closed as the result of a refresh score operation initiated by the app: if an app has a grade for a take but not mindtap, the refresh score will fix the attempt grade and status, but it will not modify the actual count on the Activity Outcome.

The logic in DefaultActivityOutcomeDetail should be altered as such:

- updateActivityOutcome: always refresh the attempts (regardless the score mode), and use an actual count of all the attempts that are closed (status 2))


Note that there are cases of discrepencies in appdev (see NG-11840), but it's hard to say if they were caused by a refresh score (although they do indicate they were not auto_submit)

fields.summary: A-head level: Broken navigation from 2+ pages RA to 1-page RA. Chapters level: Broken navigation from Ch Intro page to non-book Readings (not C360)
fields.description:
Reported by Ben.

Not happening with C360 non-book Readings "Course Information", "Unit Overview", "Lesson".

Reproducible with non-book Readings "Chapter questions", "Chapter objectives", "Chapter Overview" (Pride, Norton, Guffey).

+1. Steps to reproduce:+
e.g., Ehrlich 9781418072520 created in Course Mode A-heads level.
1. Launch MT.
2. In LPN click Unit "CHAPTER 1: Introduction to Medical Terminology" and launch RA "Section 1-2: Word Parts are the Key" (has 2+ pages) -> TOC is displayed.
*3. Click ONE time next navigation button* OR click 2 times next and 1 time back -> a user should be on the next after TOC page.
4. Open LPN and click Chapter Introduction which is a 1-page RA.

Expected result: Chapter Introduction is displayed.

Actual result: TOC of previously launched RA is displayed (though Activity Title bar gets updated with the correct Chapter title "Chapter Introduction").

Note: if after step 3 a user clicks back button in LPN, launches another Unit and opens any 1-page RA, the issue is not reproducible.



+2. Steps to reproduce:+
e.g., Pride 9780538478083 created in Course Mode Chapters Level - has Parts (can use IA - Pride 9780538478083 09/11/12).
_Prerequisites:_ several RAs have been added on different levels: on top level, within Part 1, within Unit "1: Exploring the World of Businessand Economics".(All added RAs start with "IA").

1. From LPN top level launch "IA: A-head + b-heads: Types of Competition".
2. Navigate 1 page.
3. From LPN launch 
"IA: One A-head: Business: A Definition" or 
"IA: One b-head: Why Study Business?" or
expand Part 1 and launch "IA: One A-head: Ethical Issues" or "IA: One b-head: Communications".

Actual incorrect result is as above.


+3. Steps to reproduce (same Pride book):+
_Prerequisites:_ non-book Readings and C360 non-book Readings have been added in Part 1, Unit 2.

1. Open Part 1, Unit 2, RA "2: Being Ethical and Socially Responsible".
2. Navigate to Chapter Introduction page.
3. Open LPN and launch non-book Reading (NOT C360).

Actual incorrect result is as above.


 

***
When the issue is not reproducible:
Case 1:
1. From LPN top level launch "IA: A-head + b-heads: Types of Competition".
2. Navigate 1 page.
3. Open LPN, in Folder Part 1 click *Unit* "1: Exploring the World of..."
4. Launch "IA: One A-head: Partnerships" or "IA: One b-head: Growth from Within".

Case 2:
1. In LPN in Folder Part 1 launch Unit "1: Exploring the World of...".
2. Launch *full* RA "1: Exploring the World of Business and Economics".
3. Navigate 1 page -> Introduction page is displayed.
4. In LPN click on "IA: One A-head: Partnerships" or "IA: One b-head: Growth from Within".

fields.summary: Analyze how we might get RSS Feed App to save WC changes to Master
fields.description:
Spike to outline a couple of different approaches to solve: NG-11691

We need to be able to:
* Publish a Master with RSS Feed data in it, have that data available as-is to create Snapshots from
* Create a Working Copy of that Master, allowing changes in the Working Copy that do not impact the RSS Feeds or related data in the Published Master
* Delete the Working Copy with no impact on the Published Master
* Merge the changes to the Working Copy and have the changes in the WC merged into the Published Master

fields.summary: Print of Readings (phase 1)

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
As a student or instructor, I want to be able to print my reading activities so I can view them and take notes on them offline.

Some UX designs:
https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/Printing#

Risks:
* Not meeting customer expectations
** Requests almost weekly (via tech support tickets)
** Former CL readers had print option (AText), MT needs print to meet same functionality of replaced products
* Current MT print capability is poor and uses a lot of paper (which is $ to students)
* Competition has print function

Assumptions:
* Will roll out core functionality in stages
* First stage will be print without adding annotations
* Second stage will allow users to print annotations (user generated and MT, such as footnotes). This stage is also targeted for FY13
* Print will work with any supported browser

fields.summary: Allow Kaltura's "made available to students" to be unchecked when adding an activity
fields.description:
As an Instructor adding a Kaltura activity, I want to be able to switch between items already made available to students, and items that are not, so that I can share items with students that I forgot to share previously.

Note: Kaltura should be updated to work more like Google Docs here.

Acceptance Criteria:
* When the Kaltura app is selected from the activity manager, user should be able to de-select the "Show items made available to students" and ALL items should show.
* User should be able to select a radio button for an item not previously shared, and it should become shared
** Note that we should present the user with a confirmation dialog the same way as we do with Google Docs
* Then, this item can be added as an activity

status.description: The issue is ready to be picked up
status.name: Ready

fields.summary: Print: switch between section and entire reading activity
fields.description:
As a MindTap user of any role, when I have the Print Preview up, I want to be able to switch from the Current Section (default) to the "Entire Reading Activity" so that I can control what gets printed and have good options!

Acceptance Criteria:
* When a user switches to the "Entire Reading Activity" radio button, the  preview will automatically change to re-load the entire Reading Activity content, assuming that's different than the "This Section" that's loaded by default
* It should re-load entirely and be scrolled all the way to the top
* Styling should be the same as in NG-8397 
* Need to be able to switch back to just "This Section" and back and forth

fields.summary: SPIKE: investigate single-entry-point API for Reader
fields.description:
The Reader app experiences complex defects related to presenting incorrect content, e.g. NG-10683. This is a result of timing issues related to contention between two different entry points for displaying an activity in Reader.

This spike is to answer the following questions:

* What would the desired single-entry-point Reader API look like?
* What is involved in the implementation of a single-entry-point Reader API?
** What touch points and specific dependencies will require regression testing? Where do we manipulate URLs to compensate for the current API?
** What effort is involved in the implementation?

fields.summary: Web Links : add more than one link ~ happy path
fields.description:
As an Instructor, I want to be able to add more than one URL to a Web Link activity, so that I can easily share more than one link with my students at once.

Acceptance Criteria:
* When one URL is added to a Web Link, there is an "Add another link" button available
* Clicking on this link opens a new URL field, and entering a URL validates one at a time (note: for the purposes of this story, all URLs should be valid - we're not testing the error scenarios here)
* For all URLs entered, there will be a Preview button 
* Clicking Preview grabs the same metadata as in NG-11812
** Title, Description, URL, etc.

NOTE: Need to consider a limit to the number of URLs -- can we use 5 for now? I assume I should add a separate story to show an error message if the user tries to add more than 5? Or can we just not show the "Add another link" button when there are 5?

fields.summary: Web Links : add more than one link ~ error handling and removal

fields.summary: Web Link : Date stamp is missing in the preview of the entered URL.
fields.description:
Web Link : Date stamp is not appearing in the preview of the URL  while date is available  on the site page.


Steps to Reproduce:-

-Log in with super admin.
-Go to the RA page and open RA page in the edit mode
-Click over the '+' and select the web Link app from the activity 
-Now enter the valid URL in the 'Enter URL' field 
-Click over the 'Preview button
-Verify that date stamp is not appeared with the preview.

Actual Result:- Date stamp is not appearing with the preview of the entered URL.

Expected Result:-Date stamp should be appeared in the preview of the URL

status.description: Issue has been verified as fixed and is awaiting final regression
status.name: Verified

fields.summary: CNow Homework App> Take an assignment via LPN for which  'Keep 20 results, use last one' Grading option is selected> Instructor end> System displays 'best score' instead of the 'last score' within the Progress App.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
**Issue is reproducible on Appdev/Classtest(v07.0134) server on using the SSO instructor account. 
**Issue is not verified on QAF/QA3 server(v07.0124.05) as it is not yet implemented. 
**Issue is not reproducible for all valid user roles on AppDev/QAF. 

Pre-requisites: 
1. Instructor has created a MindTap course(Cour27) and created an assignment(Assign2701). 
2. Instructor has set the grading option 'Scoring when multiple takes are allowed' option set to 'Keep 20 results, use the last one' via 'Assignments options' page. 
2. Created assignment has been linked to the LPN. 
3. Course has been enrolled to the student (stud07_mindapp@qai.com/A123456) and student has taken the assignment. 

Steps to Reproduce: 
1. Launch the URL: https://d-login.cengage.com/cb/login.htm 
2. Login with the instructor credentials: int90_mindapp@qai.com/A123456 
3. Navigate to the assignment(Assign2701) and click on Students Submitted link. 
4. Verify that system displays the 'Progress App' overlay.

Actual Result:
System displays the 'The best score from all attempts is recorded.' in the Progress App overlay
Please refer to the attached screenshot<<Scoring.jpg>>

Expected Result:
System should display the 'The last score from all attempts is recorded.' as for the activity the grading is done according to the last attempt.

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress
